 Produces a weighted sum of multiple harmonics of basic Perlin noise.

Detailed Description

This class is the Perlin noise.

What is Perlin noise: Perlin noise is a noise function (seeded random number generator) which is just several Interpolated Noise functions at different scales/frequencies added together.

float PerlinNoise::sumHarmonics2 ( const Vector2 &  vec,
float  persistence,
float  frequency,
float  nIterations 
)

Produces a weighted sum of multiple harmonics of basic Perlin noise.

It tries to return a value between 0.0 and 1.0

Parameters:
vec the input coordinates
persistence the cumulative relative weighting for each harmonic.
frequency the frequency of the harmonics
nIterations the number of harmonics to blend
